rComments: She's a great resource if you're looking to pursue a graduate school path or researcheducation career path. She is very understanding and supportive through personal emergencies and really wants her students to learn, succeed, and leave the class with something useful (like a grantresearch proposal).
I really enjoyed her class. she taught the first half of Tulaczyk's class and found a guest lecturer for every class in her half of the quarter. she is a delightful woman.

I took Environmental Geology with her. Her classes are incredibly boring & she is not very personable or nice to talk to. All  lectures are power points which she posts on line so you don't need to go to class except for guest speakers/student presentations. I ended up with a bad grade because she's not very flexible about personal circumstances.
